title: National Building Code of the Philippines

sections.title: Title
sections.summary: This Decree shall be known as the National Building Code of the Philippines.

sections.title: Declaration of Policy
sections.summary: Safeguards life, health, property, and public welfare through minimum standards in building design and construction.

sections.title: Scope and Application
sections.summary: Applies to design, construction, alteration, repair, use, occupancy, and demolition of buildings.

sections.title: General Building Requirements
sections.summary: Buildings must conform to safe construction principles and environmental safeguards.

sections.title: Site Requirements
sections.summary: Building sites must be sanitary, safe, and away from hazards.

sections.title: Definitions
sections.summary: Definitions are provided in Annex A.

sections.title: Responsibility for Administration
sections.summary: Enforcement vested in the Secretary of Public Works.

sections.title: Building Officials
sections.summary: Building Officials enforce provisions in their jurisdiction.

sections.title: Qualifications of Building Officials
sections.summary: Must be Filipino, registered architect or civil engineer with 5 years experience.

sections.title: Administrative Fines
sections.summary: Fines up to 10,000 pesos for violations.

sections.title: Penal Provisions
sections.summary: Violations punishable by fine up to 20,000 pesos or imprisonment up to 2 years.

sections.title: Building Permits
sections.summary: Building permit required before construction.

sections.title: Application for Permits
sections.summary: Requires TCT, plans, cost estimate, occupancy use.

sections.title: Issuance of Building Permits
sections.summary: Permit issued within 15 days if compliant.

sections.title: Validity
sections.summary: Permit expires if work not started within 1 year.

sections.title: Certificate of Occupancy
sections.summary: Required before use or occupancy of building.

sections.title: Types of Construction
sections.summary: Classified as Type I to Type V based on materials and fire resistance.

sections.title: Fire Zones Defined
sections.summary: Areas restricted by type of construction and fire resistance.

sections.title: Restrictions on Existing Buildings
sections.summary: Non-compliant buildings cannot be expanded unless compliant.

sections.title: Fire-Resistive Rating
sections.summary: Measures fire resistance of materials.

sections.title: Fire-Resistive Regulations
sections.summary: Standards for fire testing and materials.

sections.title: Occupancy Classification
sections.summary: Groups A–J (Residential, Institutional, Business, Industrial, Assembly, etc.).

sections.title: Mixed Occupancy
sections.summary: Most restrictive occupancy applies in mixed-use buildings.

sections.title: Ceiling Heights
sections.summary: Minimum ceiling heights specified per occupancy.

sections.title: Room Dimensions
sections.summary: Minimum room sizes: 6 sqm habitable, 3 sqm kitchen, 1.2 sqm toilet.

sections.title: Window Openings
sections.summary: Window area must be at least 10% of floor area.

sections.title: Water Supply System
sections.summary: Must connect to potable water supply and comply with plumbing code.

sections.title: Wastewater Disposal
sections.summary: Requires sewer connection or septic tank system.

sections.title: Balconies and Appendages
sections.summary: Balconies must comply with clearance and projection limits.

sections.title: Canopies (Marquees)
sections.summary: Minimum vertical clearance of 3 meters.

sections.title: Pedestrian Protection
sections.summary: Requires fences, canopies, and safety barriers.

sections.title: Excavation and Foundations
sections.summary: Must comply with engineering standards and soil safety.

sections.title: Roof Construction
sections.summary: Roof must be fire-retardant and properly drained.

sections.title: Stairs, Exits, and Occupant Loads
sections.summary: Exit width = Occupant Load ÷ 165. Minimum two exits for upper floors.
